name: Carlos M. Fernandez
text:
UPDATE 6-11-21 This business is truly worthy of a ten (10) Star rating! Once again they have come through in a professional, technically competent, and competitively priced manner. I had the barrel of my 20 gauge shotgun cut down to the regulatory length for home defense (18.5") and it came out perfect. The weapon looks like it just came out of the box! Truly a professional and talented job by the resident gun smith's! Thank you to all. Your results may vary.

BREAK

Should be in the 10+ Star club! I was extremely impressed with my first interaction with your staff. Erin (Counter Lady) and Gerald (Gunsmith) pulled it together in a timely manner installing a P365 Safety Conversion Kit on my weapon. The work was done in minimal time resulting in me feeling much safer with 12+1 configuration. Customer service was without par, quality of the work was perfect and the pricing was very competitive. Wishing you guys the best in biz. Stay safe, be alert. Best. CMF sends...

name: Chris Knight
text:
I stopped in today to test fire a new mossberg 88 I picked up. Had a hard time finding ammo before I arrived, but they happened to have a couple boxes of ammo i could use.

The staff is friendly, courteous, and very informative. They take the time to explain what it takes to fire at the range with ease, and have a cushy waiting area to view a quick training video. The whole process was smooth and easy.

The range safety officers are well on their game. I felt safe the entire time on the range, and they were able to quickly explain the touch screen track interface, and further explaining that safety is a top priority.

I signed on for 30 minutes, and decided to fire my .40 before testing the shotgun. The touch screen interface has me sold on coming back to bullet and barrel. With just a click, the target goes the exact distance. Takes all the guesswork out of the experience.

I fired my pistol, and was pleased with the range itself. The design is new and clean. And with the RSOs keeping an eye on everything, it's a great environment to enjoy your firearms.

I tried the 88, and it performed beautifully. I added some extra cushion due to a shoulder injury. For those that would ask, you can't shoot bird shot here. But you can fire buck shot and slugs. But I'll tell you, it's fun firing a shotgun at this range.

Afterward I wandered around and struck up conversations with some of the staff, and showed me a selection for sale. I was impressed with the inventory, as well as pricing. I see myself buying my next firearm from here.

For me, it's a bit of a drive from Madison. But good business is where you find it, and Bullet and Barrel is my newest one stop shop for all things firearms. Plus, open on Sunday!

Dont take my word for it, stop in and check them out today! I'll be back soon, keep up the good work guys.

resp.text: Thank you for coming down! Please come back soon and....May the force be with you ;)

name: Karen Smith
text: State of the art range! The employees are always friendly and helpful - from the sales team to the RSOs! Everyone is very professional and committed to ensuring the safety of everyone who walks through the doors. I would absolutely recommend this place to any of my friends or family without hesitation!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Please come back soon!

name: JonPaul Wise
text: I recently moved to Huntsville and wanted to find a new class 3 place to call my "local shop". This place is a perfect example of how to do things right, treated me like I was a long time customer right from the start and after just a few visits I feel like I've been coming here for years. Very veteran friendly and the facility is far beyond just a gun shop. I've lived in 8 cities over 5 states in the past 10 years and this place is on the top without a doubt!

name: Justin W (JdogAwesome)
text: Extremely well maintained and high quality range! The firearm rentals where great and the guns where in pristine condition! The range officers where super nice and helped us a ton as it was my first time using a pistol. Can't recommend this place enough!

name: Adrian Farrales
text: Bullet and Barrel is a great place! They have a wide selection of firearms and a very nice indoor range, but what I like most about this place is that they offer excellent classes relating to firearms. Jeff is one of the staff members there and he is a great teacher. The folks working at Bullet and Barrel are experts and they'll make sure you get everything right. If you're looking for instructional classes on anything related to firearms, then Bullet and Barrel is definitely the place!

name: Lynn Watts
text: Took the handgun cleaning class with Jeff.  It was very informative.  I learned how to disassemble, clean and reassemble a firearm.  The tip about the grease was especially good since I have trouble at times with pulling the slide.  Thanks for the exceptional training.

name: David Norg
text:
Needed my scope mounted on a new rifle.
Made the mistake of taking it to another popular local business to get it done. Clearly was not a professional installation.
Gerald with Bullet and Barrel reinstalled the scope and rings on the spot and did it right!
Great people and service!

name: Carrie Givens
text:
I just made the best investment today, my new Wilson combat edcx9l firearm and I love It. Jeff was extremely helpful and the experience was awesome. I just started taking classes, and Jeff made sure I knew everything that I needed to know about the firearm before I left. He was very patient, considerate, and knowledgeable. Thank you Jeff, you’re awesome!
- C T Davis

name: Marquiz Liner
text: Can’t recommend Bullet and Barrel enough! The staff is very knowledgeable and extremely helpful! The range is clean, well-maintained, and well-managed by the excellent RSOs. Everyone we’ve encountered has been super nice! If you’ve never been, I highly recommend you check them out! They’re awesome!

name: Telia Norg
text: Just had a scope remounted correctly.  Took to another gun shop and they apparently had no idea what they were doing. As soon as we showed the clerk the firearm he immediately knew what was wrong. This is our place from now on.  Thanks

name: Hilary Crimmins
text:
Nice clean and well ventilated facility.
But honestly it is overpriced, and has extremely long waits. Members get preference and can be observed jumping the line before non-members for range access. I've even had a staff member tell me that they only had 4 boxes of ammo left and would only sell to members.
Today we, two of us for one lane, arrived at 2:15pm and paid for 30 minutes on the range. We waited well over 2 hours and did not get our full 30 minutes because they were closing. It's not worth it.

resp.text: We totally understand the frustration. We were extremely busy today as I'm sure you saw! With everything going on in the firearm industry we are trying to do everything we can. But we do have members who pay a monthly fee and part of that benefit is jumping the line. Kind of like Disney! We would love for you to give us another opportunity. Please reach out to me, Louis, at 256-384-4867 and we will make sure you have a 5 star experience

name: Joyce Maxwell
text: Had a wonderful experience Saturday with my daughter's. Took a class with Tommy, can't say enough about his wonderful teaching skills. We were nervous but with Tommy's great personality it wasn't long till we were calm and enjoying ourselves. Thank you so very much. We'll definitely be back!!

name: Andrew Emmerton
text: I took a private lesson with Jeff and he was very knowledgeable, I highly recommend taking a lesson. The rest of the staff were also great and they have a great selection of firearms for sale as well as some to rent for their indoor range.

name: Chad Jones
text: Louis and the crew at bullet and Barrel are first rate and so is their facility.  I've had some minor gunsmithing done as well, mainly to check suppressor alignment and get a few breaks lockset on, service has been fast and very affordable.  I've had a few problematic firearms inspected as well and John, their gunsmith, has always been straight forward and accurate.  Of the range facilities in the area, BnB stands head and shoulders above the rest.  I have range passes to go to other ranges for free, but I would rather spend some money at BnB to be with a better crowd and make sure their level of commitment to the average gun owner is rewarded.  When it comes to stores that are in your corner as a gun owner, these guys are bar none best of the best in our area.

name: pauline bracken
text: Sarah did a fantastic job teaching me how to firearm! I actually would give her 10 ⭐️ Since I haven’t in years!! I probably will take another class before I actually buy a pistol! Thank you again for your patience and spending over 2 hours with me! I had a wonderful time!!

name: Catherine Stower
text: Sarah was a wonderful instructor!  Her patience went above and beyond what I would have expected from an instructor, and her knowledge is tremendous.  In addition, she is continuing to work with me to help me figure out the best firearm for personal use.

name: Steven Gaffin
text:
I went because I was having the hardest time removing the retaining pin from the firing pin of my Remington 870. So I took the bolt down to Bullet and Barrel. Front Desk (not really front more like back left corner) staff was very welcoming and friendly. The gunsmith was able to remove the pin and lathe down a manufacturing defect in it that was keeping it in the bolt.
I was very satisfied and impressed with Bullet and Barrel and will definitely return for the many other services they offer.

name: Chad Jones
text: Louis and the crew at bullet and Barrel are first rate and so is their facility. name: MaryAnn Green
text: Took a beginner's gun safety class.  Sarah was my instructor and was extremely knowlegeable.  She answered all my questions and gave me good advise on how to properly handle a fire arm.  She provided helpful hints on the firing range.  I plan on meeting with her again for more instruction.

name: Steve S
text: Excellent instruction and advice from Jeff White! He is extremely knowledgeable and taught me a ton of tips to correct my technique. Thank you so much! It's just a great facility. Clean, professional, helpful.

name: Ethan Brewer
text: Alberto is the man. Great customer service. We talked about many different guns. He knew the product, and I could tell he was genuinely trying to help me.

name: Eugene Mayo
text: My first visit to Bullet & Barrel was a very pleasant experience. I expected the normal indoor gun range with no frills and a lack of management personnel for the amount of customers. Not at Bullet & Barrel! You enter the establishment and find yourself in a first class gun store with very tastefully displayed products. When you check in to the range most of the paper work is done electronically and there are plenty of well trained staff on hand to help you, not only at check in but on the range also. Defiantly not a Mom & Pops business. Top notch!

name: J Cowan
text: Great place for learning how to shoot or just for practice. My husband and I visited and enjoyed it. Truly learned at lot from our instructor Sarah. She was very knowledgeable and very patient. We learned so much. She walked through every detail with us together and separately, as we each own two different guns. Highly recommend! Thank you Sarah!! We will be back.

name: Dorothy Loftin
text: Thank you Tim for a great lesson on learning to get comfortable with a gun! I was with my sister and friend, both of whom had experience with guns.  Tim tailored the class for all 3 of us with varying abilities.  I had never touched a gun and was shooting with multiple guns by the end of the session.  The best part of it all is now I’m comfortable with the gun we have in our home.  Thanks again Tim!  We will definitely be back for more lessons!

name: Randy Chavez
text: Went in the is morning for the first time to sight in my hunting rifles. WOW!  Got hooked up with George and he did it all. Helped me sight in four rifles is one hour, explained everything he was adjusting and just made the experience unbelievable. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Thanks George!

name: Emilee Taritero
text: My twins took the Youth Marksmanship Class  with Sarah as part of their 13th bday weekend. She was amazing! She was so patient with the group of kids. She explained everything very well and made sure the class understood all the points of gun safety and operation which allowed them to have an amazing time once they got the hands on experience on the range. My twins DID NOT want to leave.  We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you do much!!! Sarah is a great instructor! Please come visit us again soon!

name: vivaswanth c
text:
Great range. Courteous people and very encouraging trainers.
Modern equipment and look. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! Please come back and visit soon :)

name: Nelly Belly
text: Best range in Huntsville.... and it’s not even close. I became a member when they were still building it because I knew it would be a great place and they have exceeded my expectations. The ranges are well lit and spotless. The thickness of the barriers between the ranges was a major selling point to me. I feel safe and secure when I am on my lane. The range masters are helpful and add another layer of protection for the customers/ members that are throwing lead at a target. I strongly suggest you give Bullet and Barrel a shot (pun intended) if you are looking for a place to shoot. Beware, this place can become addictive.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate your continued support

name: diane rigsby
text: A friend and I took the first steps class from instructor Sarah.  Sarah gave great instruction emphasizing safety first.  She was very patient.  I learned A lot and will go back in the future.  Also the facility was very clean.

name: Jasmine Tucker
text: If you’ve heard about this place and have not stop by, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? This place is awesome! It’s clean, and there’s safety videos which made me feel safe and my favorite part was that the staff made me feel comfortable. I encountered Sarah who is so patient and knowledgeable. This was my first time using my new .380 and she encouraged me to practice more with it and not be discouraged. Just when I thought the place couldn’t get any better I even had the same experience as I exited by Pam she’s so sweet she explained to me about how to become a member. This place sells everything too!

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! Please come back soon 😃

name: Larry Parker
text: Excellent facility. Great instruction on gun safety and usage from Jeff White. Highly recommend Jeff for a private or group lesson.

resp.text: Jeff does an awesome job!!!! Please come visit us again soon!!! And let us know if we can help you further

name: Ivica Ristovski
text: This is a very good place. Staff is super nice. Clean building, very nice shooting range. I would say best in town. Perfect for pistol shooting.

resp.text: Thank you!! All of lanes are also rifle rated as well!

name: Clint Beavers
text: The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Sarah answered all my questions, demonstrated gun safety, and made my first time experience an enjoyable one.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!!! Sarah is a great part of the team! Please come see us again soon

name: Zachary Talley
text: This is the best gun shop in Alabama. Fastest and most professional service. I dropped my gun off with new scope John amd Alberto had all the necessary mounting hardware in stock.  1 hour they mounted ,bore sighted and zeroed in at there 100 yard range. EXCELLENT SERVICE and very well trained gun smith and employees.

name: FryingPan
text: Got a membership to this place and its worth every penny. Excellent range officers and all very professional. The ranges themselves are very clean and ventilated. There is ample space for any weapons you want to bring. They have a huge selection of weapons to rent (free with membership) which was one of the big selling points of the membership for me. Once you shoot here you won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank so much! We appreciate you joining the family!

name: braxton guthrie
text: Extremely respectful over the phone was very refreshing, normally because of my age (21) I'm in between being treated as an adult and an adult.

name: david schachle
text: If you are looking to learn how to shoot, I highly reccomend Jeff. He is very nice and profesional. They have a clean range and store. Very fun experience.

name: Bryson Hill
text:
After going to three other places in Huntsville and the big box store across from Bridge street that has the street named after them along with there sales add and waiting in line for hour two find out that they did not have one or ever had one.
For now on Bullet and Barrel has my business best prices in town Thomas was my sales person he was a great help . Everyone was very nice I encourage anyone that is in the market for firearm visit Bullet and Barrel

name: donald reimer
text: Very clean, safe and very nice range people are very helpful and friendly no attitude will definitely return when back in town

resp.text: Come back and see us! Travel safe

name: Charles Pruitt
text: The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the gun range is awesome. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, if you're looking for a place to shoot, try them out. They've definitely earned my business.

name: Galvin Freeman
text: First visit here to shoot and I was very, very impressed with the entire staff from start to finish! This place has that it factor and has lots of potential to become a gem here in Huntsville! The indoor range takes it to another level. Definitely recommend checking this place out! You won't be disappointed! I enjoyed my visit and will be back.

resp.text: Please come back soon!

name: J B
text:
First, I must say that the range facilities are quite nice with helpful staff. The range facilities are up to date, very comfortable and the RSOs are very professional.

However, I made the mistake of using the gunsmith services. This has not gone well. This particular saga has been going on since the end of November. I always had to call or email them to get any status and the answer was always the same...it will be ready Saturday, it will be ready next week, it will be ready "sometime next week". I do not believe that they have devoted any significant time to my project. The first time I checked in with them after a week, that is when they informed me I needed to bring in other components. They never reached out to me. Very frustrating. Now that it is in Jan I have given up working with them and I am now taking the project somewhere else.

I get the feeling that they want to work on things when they feel like it, have no obligation to provide status or time estimate to the customer. Furthermore, I do not believe that they have fulltime gunsmiths which feels a little misleading from the website.

So if any readers know a professional, hardworking gunsmith in the area I am certainly looking!

resp.text: Hey JB! we're so sorry this was your experience. Normally our Gunsmiths can offer quick turn around times. Some thing may change that with parts availability and waiting on other parts we need from our customers. I am sorry we were back logged at the time and when we received your receiver in late December we began to diagnose the problem. But again that's no excuse for a lack of communication. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance

name: Andre Harris II
text:
Went to buy a light for my handgun and I received quick and friendly service. I was also lucky enough to receive a small discount while I was there.
Clean and an open environment also

name: Ethan Owens
text: A truly epic indoor shooting range. Truly the best in Alabama. Seriously. Plus I don’t have to worry about lead poisoning or negligent discharges by employees. They’re prices are really decent as well. Not the cheapest but well worth the price because of the great value they represent.

name: Sara Bozeman
text: Jerrell, the gunsmith, literally saved my weekend. I went in on a Friday needing to sight in a new rifle before going hunting for the weekend. My mounts were machines improperly and couldn’t hold a zero. Jerrell skipped his lunch to fix my mounts, and did an amazing job. The rest of the staff was very helpful, kind, and generous with advice. I love how clean and fresh the facilities are as well. Not many gun ranges are so well kept! I’ll be going back, and definitely using Jerrell for any work I need done on a gun.

resp.text: We love our gunsmiths!!! Please come back and see ya soon!  😀

name: Kenyon Stone
text: Such a great place! Staff very helpful and friendly. Brought a 12 year old, they had some options for her, and were making sure she enjoyed herself as well. Tim was a great help, felt very welcome

name: Caitlin Thomas
text: Such an enjoyable experience.  Highly recommend Bullet & Barrel

name: Destiny Freeman
text: We had such a great time here! Friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive staff. The range and facilities are very well maintained and clean. Wonderful range and personable people. Win win. Thank you!

name: DAN From the SOUTH
text: This is by far my favorite shooting range to use in Huntsville! Very friendly environment and extremely kid friendly. My son always says "Bullet and Barrel" when I ask him where he wants to go!! Well done guys!

resp.text: Thanks!!!! We like to think we're all a big family 😀😀😀

name: Matt Ray
text: No better place in Huntsville to buy a silencer.  You can even use it in the range while waiting on the government.  Silencer shop kiosk makes the process super simple, and the staff are excellent to work with.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Mike K
text: I took Louis up on his offer of a tour of Bullet and Barrel as my previous experience was less than stellar.  The experience this time was quite the opposite of my last visit; even before I met Louis.  I was greeted as soon as I entered the building and was pointed in the right direction to meet Louis.  The tour was thorough, and as suspected the facilities are top notch, and they offered quite a bit more than I expected.  The gun range is state of the art and the RSO's are extremely helpful.  The staff is friendly, professional and quite knowledgeable .  Thank you Louis, and the entire Bullet and Barrel staff for an exceptional experience.  I most definitely will be back.

resp.text: Mike, I am so sorry that this is what you experienced with us today. We pride ourselves on giving our customers an awesome experience. As our reviews reflect that this is not our norm. But I'd love to personally invite you back and I'll give you a behind the scenes tour of our facility. Thank you for the feedback and we truly hope we can deliver a 5-star response on you next visit. If you'd like to set this up my personal email is louis@bulletandbarrel.com~ Louis, General Manager

name: Rick Morgan
text:
Jason did an excellent job teaching me how to shoot. He caught and corrected all my aiming problems.
A really great teacher!

name: Thomas Webber
text: I have been to Bullet and Barrel many times. Always a great time and the staff treat you right. Best place in Huntsville!!!

name: Danta Simonsen
text: My son and I took a gun safety class and had a great time. The instructors were knowledgeable and made the class fun without loosing the seriousness of what we were there to learn. Tim took extra time to help my son making him feel confident. He was very encouraging no matter how bad my aim was. Excellent service, great facilitie. Highly recommend.

name: Michael Mauro
text: Hands down, the best Gun Range I've ever visited. I've lived across 5 states and have visited ranges in each one. This one has, by far, exceeded my expectations in all areas. The staff are immensely helpful, friendly and professional. Thank you for your clean facility and expert staff!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!!!! And for bringing us some cool guns to work on~louis

name: Bridgette Bradley
text: We had our corporate event here. The employees were simply wonderful! Everyone was very knowledgeable and cared about each person in attendance. The facility is immaculate! The shooting range itself is the best in Huntsville. Highly recommend Bullet and Barrel!!

name: Jacob Boyett
text: Went in as a newbie shooter and within 2 minutes of being in the range Dave stepped up and immediately told me things I could correct and even went so far as to give me some drills to run. I would recommend Dave and B&B to anybody. See you guys next week!

name: Barrett Eimer
text: Great range to shoot at with nice lanes and technology; they have a decent selection of quality guns and rifles too. They also sell apparel for men and women.  It comes together as a welcome and unique blend of ideas for a place to shop.  There is a ton of space and it will be cool to see how they intend to make use of it all.

name: Weston Hall
text: What a fun professional place! Very clean and the staff was very friendly. They weren’t intimidating and was nice when I asked them questions.

resp.text: Thank you so much! Please visit us again soon!!

name: Ira Merritt
text: I have used the range at B&B  a number of times and the staff is always friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and safety conscious. I also recently did a trade and had gun smithing done on an AR. My interactions have all been very satisfactory. John, the gunsmith, and others went far out of their way to resolve a non-standard hardware problem in a way that I greatly appreciated. Great staff and operation.

name: Jay Graham
text: My wife and I shot guns for the first time. We had an excellent experience. We took a personal class from Colt, a fantastic instructor! He is very knowledgeable, explains things clearly, and kept us feeling confident throughout the entire process. We're already looking forward to our next visit.

name: Miki Heaton
text: First time to visit this range, very nice facility and clean well maintained range. I would have given it 5 stars if not for two things. When we walked in the door two employees behind the counter were on their cell phones and didn’t look up until we spoke. Then when we walked on the range the range officer was also on his phone. In each case neither were talking only looking at the screen.  I personally have a problem with employees being on their phones at work but on a firing range just seems like a really bad idea.

name: Will Booker
text: I drove all the way across town to get there still in line for 5-10 minutes they let two people in front of me go on to the range and then told me that they just took the last person on the range and turned me away. It wasn't covered related because they weren't busy. I won't be going back thanks for nothing

resp.text: Thank for leaving this feedback! As you can see typically the strong majority of our guests have 5 star experiences. Talking this over with our team we looked back at your trip. We do have a pretty firm rule on not allowing shooters on the range 30 minutes before we close. The folks who went ahead of you are some of our members and one of their perks is lane priority. We would absolutely love for you to give us another chance and I would like to invite you back as my guest and comp you your range time. ~Louis S.

name: Matt White
text: I am so happy with the experience I had shopping for my gun parts and my new purchase of the noveske space invader! They have answered every question that I have had. I usually give a name to ask for but theres no need in this best gun/shooting range in north alabama! Everyone is very knowledgeable. This place is amazing!

name: Matt Hamblin
text: Great staff and an amazing range. Oozes professionalism and safety. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Come visit us again soon

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! Please come visit us again soon and if there is anything we can do please let us know~Louis

text: Great place to shoot!  Awesome service and staff especially the range officers.  They were both friendly and helpful all while being professional.  This was my first trip but it sure won’t be my last!

text: These is the best range in North AL. The range is well lit, climate controlled, and each lane is very spacious. But the best part are the people who work here. I cannot give enough praise for my favorite place in Huntsville.

resp.text: I do apologise that this was your experience! This is so strange to hear because Jeff is one of our most lauded employees. Although we do apologise that we didn't meet your expectations I'd love to discuss your experience. Please call me on Tuesday at 256-384-4867 ~Louis GM

text: Who likes to shop for dress clothes? Not I. But sometimes it has to be done.  You simply can’t beat the price, selection, and service here. I live at the beach so don’t wear fancy stuff often, but whenever I do, BB in Foley will be the go-to. Thanks Casey!

text: Came in to purchase items for my brother and dad. There was only one other customer in the store. There was an older lady not doing much and a man assisting the only other customer. I was in there for a while and was never greeted or asked if I needed help. I felt like I was being stereotyped. Little did they know, my budget to spend was no less than 1k. I walked out after ten or more minutes of not being spoken to. My dad has several BB items but after this experience, I will never shop with them again. I made a special trip to the store because there is not one where I live. I'd give zero stars if possible.

I will be returning them as this isn’t possibly how a bra should feel.  Everything I got didn’t fit. 😞. Will edit review depending on how the return and “new fitting goes”.

name: Joy Amberson
text: I came in here and bought a bra for my daughter. She tried it on and loved it and I got it to the counter and I wanted to buy her another one in a different color. They gave me the wrong bra and I pointed out that something was different at the register but she said it was the same. Then when she rang it up I noticed that it cost more and she said it was because it was a different color.  I thought that was strange but didn't want to say anything. I got home and went to wash them and sure enough, one of them was different. When I took it back they charged me a different price and made me pay extra for the different bra even though it was the  The one that I paid the most for the first time. So it cost me time and gas money because I do not live anywhere close to this place and more money because they messed up and they refused to do anything about it.

text: Love these clothes! They last a very long time.  Seriously,  I have shirts that are 15 years old that I still wear. They look relatively new. I also love the NEXT plan. The extra off is usually a surprise and makes me happy! The staff is always friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing what an awesome experience you had with the team at the Bel Air Mall EXPRESS. We forwarded your feedback to the District Manager so that they know what a special time you all had in the store. If you should have any additional questions, feel free to reach us at 1-888-397-1980.

name: A1aerials Droner
text: Great place for competitive paying jobs.

name: Dani Cakes
text:
My son, who is kind of shy, had a school dance coming up so we were in need of a suit. We didn’t know where to start and neither my son nor I had any confidence in what to even look at.
When we walked in, Malcolm headed straight for us and instantly took us under his wing. He patiently spent close to an hour helping my son find the right fit, the right color (for his skin tone) and to match his date’s dress. We found everything we needed except for the tie. We were so very pleased with the purchase we made. But the most important thing we left with, was my son’s confidence! Malcolm told my son “to stand up straight, lift your head up, and be confident in the good looking guy that he is”
As a mom, to a shy teenage boy,  this means the world to me!
When we left to go find the tie at a different store, we were totally lost again. My son said “mom, do you think we can go get Malcolm to help us?” They may not ever see each other again but this guy with the exceptional customer service skills made a LIFELONG impact on my son. Express, I hope you realize how great of an employee you have in Malcolm. I wish the world was filled with more Malcolms.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing what an awesome experience you had with the team at the Bel Air Mall EXPRESS. We forwarded your feedback to the District Manager so that they know what a special time you all had in the store. If you should have any additional questions, feel free to reach us at 1-888-397-1980.

This is not the place I want to give my money too.

name: Matthew Thames
text:
I’m an official Auburn nut, and if your like me…this is your place!

They have a lot of great items at great prices! Very nice staff, highly recommended!

resp.text: Matthew, thanks so much for shopping at Alumni Hall and the kind words. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jim Hawkins
text: I probably spend 1000.00 a year in this store but I have spent my last dime.  I purchased 4 sweatshirts for my wife at Christmas.  We were out of town at Christmas and of the 4 there was 1 that she did not want.  Because of Covid concerns and some personal issues I was not able to bring the item back for a refund untill today.  While the young man was very nice, he stated that I had waited too long to return this item and that "they" would not allow him to scan the barcode for the refund.  Now I understand this to a point but I am sure that this could have been handled and that I could have recieved my refund.  I would expect a little understanding after the last year we have all had.  This is only a $60.00 item and I can assure you that I will be taking the other $940.00 that I would have spent at Alumni Hall this year to another local store.  I assure you that J&M would have honored my request.  I hope the owner is ok with this loss in potential income for a $60.00 refund.

resp.text:
Hi Jim, we are sorry to hear about your experience at our store in Auburn. We did speak with our staff about this situation. We appreciate you being a loyal customer with us, but we do however have a return policy that our store must abide by. We did extend our return policy to January 1, 2021 due to the pandemic, but it has since returned to the 30 day standard. Normally our return policy is only 30 days after purchase. The return also must be put back on the original form of payment which our staff said you no longer had. We would be happy to offer you a gift card or have your next online order shipping on us. We do value your business. If you wish to receive a gift card or free shipping, email marketing@alumnihallstores.com.

text: I shop here very frequently.  I can always find plus size clothes that I love and look great on me here.  Over many years of buying stuff here I've only ever had to return one shirt that shrank when I washed it in cold water and air dried it.  Other than that everything is of good quality and lasts.  A nice shirt/blouse here will be around $30-45. You can find items cheaper on the clearance rack. They also have jewellery and accessories to complete your look.   You can always count on workers here to help you out by taking the clothes you've amassed hanging over your arm to try on and placing them in a dressing room for you.  Their sales are killer here too.  Make sure to sign up to get coupons texted to you.  It's nice having a coupon code in your phone nearly everytime you shop to save 30% or more off.

If they are that miserable working at CR, FIND ANOTHER CAREER. A customer service job is obviously NOT for you. Shelia, is one disgusting human being that needs prayer. I really hope corporate steps in because those workers are tarnishing the reputation of Charlotte Russe. I love CR, but I would advise any and everyone I know and don't know not to shop at that particular location. They are simply rude.

name: matt m.
text:
As a male I get the impression that females that work there (Keep in mind there was no indication of any male employees in sight) seem to dislike men and attempt to discourage them from applying and working there. Certainly not an all inclusive environment as every company tries to promote themselves as today and one makes no illusions from the moment you walk through the door. The first female employee I encountered attempted to discourage me from applying by saying that she didn’t think there were any positions open when I had already checked online and the company website did indicate that there were positions available. She suddenly changed her tune when I told her I had seen this.

Time and place is a strange phenomena. Different time, different place I’d be willing to bet these same females would have no problem themselves with complaining about inclusion and equality if the same situation were reversed.

P.S. It’s not too prophetic on my part to now state what the obvious will be. Once the store manager comes upon this review, mark my words, ( As an agent of the company and for the companies behalf, and by proxy for their own self preservation) she will surely state how she did tell me that their was a position open but it wasn’t very many hours, and that I am welcome to file an application because it is an all inclusive company that does not discriminate. Unfortunately that only goes so far and becomes the venerable “lip service”; And at different stores, in different places it may very well be an all inclusive company, but not here at this one.

name: Gemma Fowler
text: My sister-in-law needed a dress for her daughter's upcoming July wedding.  She had shopped everywhere and had come up short and was discouraged. I met her at The Clothes Tree and what a fantastic experience it was! Mandy was so helpful and encouraging. She alone is reason to shop here! She could not have been more patient or helpful and gave us her undivided attention. My sister-in-law tried on about 40 dresses. The selection at this store is amazing and vast. A couple of the dresses she tried on were from the clearance rack that were marked down 80%. She tried on dresses up to almost $1000. Mandy and the other girl who was helping other customers both agreed that one of the dresses from the clearance rack was best suited for her. It was true and we were both so impressed that they weren't just interested in making the most money they could but were honest about which dress looked the best on her. It was the best dress shopping experience either of us had ever experienced. I highly recommend this shop to anyone in need of a formal dress and I plan to go there when my daughter gets engaged to find my own MOB dress. How have I missed this treasure all these years?!

name: Ron Boisclair
text: Outstanding selection of women's formal wear, exceptional service from Mandy. A 5-star experience from the time we entered. We bought a beautiful formal dress for attending an August wedding.  Forget Saks, Macy's, Belks, etc.  Make Clothes Tree your first stop.

name: Tiffany Terry
text: This is a hidden gem. I can not express how awesome this place is. They are a consignment shop, however, if you are wanting to have them purchase your items.. You'll want to make an appointment asap, as they are usually booked solid a few weeks out. If you're just wanting to shop however, check them out! The store appears small (as it's in a shopping center), however, it's much larger and will offer you hundreds of gently used items too glance through. They are currently (to my knowledge) selling women's, men's, and a small amount of children's clothing, shoes, and accessories. This place is fun, so plan on allowing yourself extra time so you can really look around!!

text:
Mr. Tiemann, I am not sure what you mean by a typical consignment shop?  I did not realize Birmingham was full of shops like this one.  I am taking it this is what you mean by typical?

Do not listen to Mr. Tiemann, this is a fabulous place to shop and the experience is as good as it gets!!!  The merchandise is not cheap (I do agree), but the quality of the merchandise and the extraordinary service that is offered every single time you walk in the shop is not touched in the state of Alabama!  I promise you!!!!!!

If you want to have a fun time, go shopping at The Clothes Tree!!!

name: Niky Li
text: Horrible experience! The staff wouldn’t let me purchase shoes because they claimed I had already been there earlier that day. I usually NEVER set foot in Finish Line. I have 0 points on my rewards. They also claimed they had footage of me on their security cameras but couldn’t show proof of it. They lied about the shoes they had in stock. I was offered one size, but after some discussion in the back, the staff told me that size wasn’t available anymore and i couldn’t purchase anything because of my “previous visit that morning.” I can’t believe the staff lied and would not let a buying customer purchase from this store, just so they can keep the shoes for themselves!!

name: Chelsea Williams
text: Placed an order online to pick up in store. Received confirmation email but no other communications about pickup. Called customer service to cancel the order after 3 days of hearing nothing and they said I had to call the store. Called this store & they said my order had “already been processed out as if were picked up on accident .” I asked them to go ahead & cancel the order anyway since I clearly had not come to pick it up. They said they would have to see my ID in store to process the cancellation . I asked why no ID was needed to “process it out” to begin with & they said it was a mistake. I asked what happens if I don’t pick up the shoes, thinking they would have to automatically issue the refund, and these people said the shoes would just sit there since their system shows that I had paid & picked them up. They refused to cancel my order & insisted I had to show them my ID to get my money back. Customer service determined that  was A LIE!!! Had to call customer service back & get them to call this store just to get my money back. Terrible customer service. Never shopping here again.

name: Jacob Li
text: Horrible staff. My cousins and I went to buy some Jordan’s at the Finishline in Dothan, Alabama. They let me check out and they then went to get a size 11 for my cousin but then came back to tell us that another employee claimed that he already saw us here earlier this morning. Not only did they refuse show any proof (cameras) that we were here, they were rude and it didn’t seem like they cared. After that, I told my brother to come and get the size 11 for my cousin. They then said that every size had been raffled off and that only size 8 was available! I’m 100% sure that they planned on backdooring the pairs for themselves or to resell. Why would a shoe store manager refuse to sell shoes to customers and lie, claiming that we were here earlier but we all rode in the same car. This is most definitely the shopping worst experience I’ve ever had.

text: No one greeted me when I walked in the store. The girl at the cash register seemed extremely upset that I was dropping off clothes. An older lady told me I have to come back in an hour and they will not call me to remind me. Which is totally fine, but the way she said it was rude. When I came back to receive the offer of cash or store credit the same girl at the register mumbled the offer and I couldn’t hear her. I asked her to repeat, and she said it with even more of an attitude than the first time. She told me what they didn’t accept I could pick up “over there” not giving any instruction on where that would be. My husband and I walked around the counter looking for my items and could not find them. We asked her, “where are they?” And she acted like she didn’t hear us. So we just left. Whatever they didn’t take, they can have. Extremely unprofessional and I will not be back or recommend anyone else to do business with this company.

I finished shopping and was fixing to ask her is there any way she could call her manager and ask, since I live in Florida and couldn't come back if she would take extra off, and before I could finish my sentence when I was at in there any way, she cut me off abruptly and said NO MAAM I CANNOT.  I was rather shocked. She clearly was rude, didn't listen and could care less. The manager is Kim and I plan to let her know. This was about 430pm.  If you want better customer service  and cheaper prices go to the one over by walmart at the north end. It's much better.

name: Brittney Pettis
text: I wanted to sell some items before leaving town, so I took a basket full of clothes over on a Thursday afternoon at 4:30 PM and the girl behind the counter told me they weren’t buying clothes anymore that day because the (1?) person that buys had left already, so I had to leave my basket until I got back into town one Saturday. When I got to the store on Saturday around 5:45 PM two girls were behind the counter. I gave them my name and they pulled two items out of a black bin and I inquired about the whereabouts of my basket and the other clothes. The girl replied, “they’re over there,” and asked the other girl behind the counter to process my buy so she could go be on her phone. Once the buy was processed and I got my money, I waited a few minutes for one of them to get my items they didn’t buy. They didn’t, so I asked if I could have my basket. The girl who was on her phone said ambiguously, “they’re over there,” and pointed haphazardly towards a wall and went back to her phone. I found my items and left. This customer service is unacceptable and disappointing. I’ll be taking my business to Plato’s.

The service was disgraceful, and the blonde lady said I had a lot of children's clothing and we only had 2-3 articles out of about 40. They tried to give us $5 for two designer purses (one of which are was over $100 and never been used.) Would not recommend to my worst enemy. If I could I would give below a one star.

name: Keegan Williamson
text:
I can't believe all the negative reviews I'm seeing. Uptown is bar none, the best place in Dothan, or the tri-county area, to buy men's clothing. When I first moved to the area I immediately went to Plato's Closet to see what the Dothan branch had to offer, the short version is, not much. After going to Plato's several times in a 90 day time period and never finding anything of merit, a co-worker took me to Uptown Cheapskate one day before work. That's when it all made sense. The reason Plato's Closet was completely barren was because everybody went to Uptown, and I'm all for it because their price is easily half of what Plato's would charge and their selection is vastly superior.

I would also like to point out that the owner of Uptown has never been anything but extremely accommodating, courteous, and immensely helpful. If you don't like the value she gives you're clothing or accessories the solution is quite simple, shop elsewhere! As for me, when I'm able to not only buy two pairs of Bullhead pants(the clothing line has been discontinued since Pac-Sun went under and has become like finding a needle in a haystack) but also a beautiful yellow and blue Ralph Lauren cardigan, all for less than $30!? I know better than to look a gift horse in the mouth.

Truly leagues above their so called competition.

resp.text: thanks

They don’t greet you when you walk in. I had jewelry in a separate bag so it wouldn’t get damaged, when I picked up the bag the jewelry was just thrown in the bag and tangled. They seem annoyed every time someone walks in. The customer service is not great at all, will not be returning.

name: Angi Whatley
text:
My husband and I stopped by this store while we were in Huntsville for some new toys. The blonde sales lady that helped us was excellent. One of the toys we purchased malfunctioned that same evening. The store was closed the next day and we were traveling home (5 hours away) so I called the store on the following day to get a replacement. I left a message with my information. Never heard a word from the store. I called back and I was told I could bring the toy back and they would troubleshoot it and/or replace it. I explained that I live 5 hours away. The sales lady said she would have the manager call me back that same day. I haven’t heard a word from the manager and I am very disappointed in their customer service. I was originally told that the product I purchased had a year warranty and if I had any issue at all to let the store know. This toy was expensive! Buyer beware!!!

Update: the owner of Sultry reached out to me and was wonderful! My toy will be replaced and I am satisfied! This is a very nice store.

resp.text:
Hello Angi,
I’m so sorry you experienced any issues with covering the warranty under Sultry’s 30 days. We tried to follow up the day of (May 7th) but we were informed you were at a graduation and you would not be able to answer. Tiffany  contacted you the next day (May 8th) and left a message on your voicemail that we could ship out the replacement with no issues due to the distance.

I’m sorry there was a hiccup but we always try to make things right for our clients. If you would like to call and continue with the options we left on your voicemail we will gladly follow through with the warranty exchange.

Please contact Tiara to further assist 2568804884.

* Called and left a message today May 15th to provide more assistance.
Thank you

name: Chuck Missildine
text: Very clean establishment. I literally did not see one piece of paper or similar debris on the floor. Shelves were nicely organized with price tags, clearance racks and store personel easy to find. Everyone (employees and customers alike) was wearing their masks and following social distancing guidelines which made the whole experience even more pleasant since I was shopping with several friends including my one year old great niece and a lifelong friend who has an extremely compromised  immune system from struggles with Crohn's disease. Scored a ton of bargains on name brands and designer's fashions. Seriously, I got my great niece a pair of sneakers and a pair of adorable boots for only $2 each. By the way, they were made by none other than the legendary JUICY COUTURE. I would have had to shell out another $45-$65 if I had purchased these designer's labels from elsewhere.  I felt practically criminal after swiping a game carrying case plus a glass screen protector (two separate items) for my son's NINTENDO SWITCH. I paid $5 for both which saved me about $15 and earned me HUGE POINTS with my son. How about this bit of awesomeness: $3 for Beyonce Pulse perfume, 3.4 ounce bottle, normally $15 or more. I also grabbed 2 hoodies for $1 each. And whatever you do, do NOT get me started on the huge savings and discounts I racked up on for the rest of the clothing that I bought as an early birthday present to myself.

name: Becky Duckett
text: Old Navy=BAD NEWS.  BIG red signs on doors and windows say "50% Off Everything", so I decided to purchase overpriced face masks.  I got to the counter with 2 packages and found out that "masks are excluded".  Although not happy, I decided to go ahead and purchase for the sake of supporting local retailers.  Within 5 minutes, I discovered that the masks are only one layer of fabric, so I went back to return them. After waiting in line, I was told "masks are not returnable".  I suggested that they check the time on the receipt since I couldn't have worn them, but they just pointed to a very small sign near the checkout that said masks were not returnable.  So... a huge bait and switch sale sign, a tiny disclaimer sign, and I am stuck with $25 of worthless little pieces of cloth.  Bad business practices, Old Navy. What good does it do to make a sale that gains you a disgruntled customer?  Old Navy will never get my business again, and I will encourage my friends to stay away, too.

text: Cool place to visit. My 1st time at a Bass Pro Shop. Would recommend going at least once to check out the set up,the Bass and Alligator Gar tank&the gorgeous boats are a plus!! Lots of Country Instagram worthy props in there! Lol 😆😆😆 Also I thought most of the stuff was over priced in there. Just a little!

name: Mudd Mannipulater
text:
Smaller store than what I am use to. Staff was around but not overly helpful. The woman working the door was very helpful and a great example of how All the employees should act. The check out process was excellent. The staff on the 2nd floor were on their phones and they showed no motivation. The guy in the gun department was the same. He could not find the item I wanted. He didn't offer to order it in or to order it on-line. I was willing to do either.
The boat and ATV guy lost a sale  since they could not break free from their conversation to help me. I hate pushy sales people but at least acknowledge me after you see me taking pictures and returning to the same area 3 times.
I never saw anyone in the clothing departments so I didn't get the items that I wanted  to stock up on.
I return to Bass Pro because of the quality of the products and it is normally easy to get help. I did not find that at this store.
It was a surprise to find the outside water features seemed neglected too.  I  didn't see any fish and the fountains and falls that are normally seen were not there either.
Luckily I can find another store close by to get what I'm looking for.
I spent FAR less than I normally do at THIS Bass Pro store and I still need to do my spring shopping.
I will not return to this store if I can another one close by.

Please understand that this store is not exactly bad, it just doesn't have the warm welcoming flow and energy that I have grown fond to.

text: We arrived 45 minutes prior to closing and needed camping supplies. A staff member at the door pointed us upstairs and we headed towards Camping. There were no staff upstairs and we couldn't find what we needed. I had to go downstairs and into the Fishing section to find an employee. He said everyone was doing inventory and not helping customers. He looked online, found the item I needed, and confirmed the were out of stock. He then referred me to Walmart if I need it quickly.

name: James Shouldis
text: it's a great place to shop. for clothes as well Sporting Goods, cookout equipment as well as smoking equipment  always enjoy going there.

name: Cristy Atkinson
text: Great help in the boat dept. The clearance items were still a little pricey but you can find some finds. Checking out was really helpful as I had gift cards and discounts on my card.

name: Kriss Payne
text: Our puppies had a great time exploring the store, huge selection.

name: Roy Forrest
text: This is without a doubt my favourite outdoor sporting goods store in all of Alabama Bass Pro Shops has everything I want it's like being a kid in a candy store with unlimited resources for money it is just an outstanding place I could actually spend the whole day in there and never feel like I got everything I wanted to get done finished And the associates in Bass Pro Shops are beyond reproach they are so helpful and so courteous and they are very easy to talk to and extremely knowledgable I truly cannot say enough good about this place.

name: George Cates
text: 58 years old in my day we would look at the sears cateloge and the first real gun we would get , fishing gear , bikes daydream for ever. Today I walked into the dream but it was real!!!! Great people quality merchandise. My first day in Bass Pro  Shop!!!! Going back next week. Take weeks to see it all.

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: Such a cool place...me and my kiddos had a great experience.  My son finally found his boots he'd been wanting and me and my daughter enjoyed the fish

name: Edward Perry
text: Fly fishing inventory lacking. Out of many important items. Otherwise pleasant experience

name: Wanda Kelley
text: Love coming to the Bass Pro Shop during the holidays.  It's so very festive and beautiful.  My favorite, of course, is the fireplace! The Christmas tree was awesome! The sales associates were extremely friendly and helpful.  My grandson and I had a great time.

name: Sierra Wyndsong
text: They always have everything we need, and they always provide exceptional service!

name: Cosmic Librarian
text: Who doesn't enjoy walking around Bass Pro? It was a very quiet Friday afternoon and my family and I were able to take our time and enjoy walking through the store. Nice place with friendly employees.

name: Hope Gainey
text: Great service here for husband's engine as expected and so many cute clothes!! Haha, didn't know they had clothes.

name: William Griffith
text: All employees were so welcoming when we brought our dog. They were even gracious enough to give him a treat.

name: Brian Boland
text: Always love bass pro we have seen 30 of them some are spectacular. This one was no exception

name: Joseph Hardin
text: At this bass pro they were more worried about pushing their Mastercard program than actual customer service. I was trying to buy boots in their shoe dept and needless to say the associate never came. After waiting an hour nobody walked through. Plus the associate where the guns are so acted like I was interrupting his conversation. I'm very disappointed. I'm not a local to this place I was passing through and it turned out to be a total waste of time.

name: Mike Lewis
text: More like an adventure than shopping. Lots of fun and they even had a little amo that I needed

name: Jose Euvin
text: I must say it's lost a lot of it's great quality. I can go to Walmart and get a better kayak for half the price. I'm very disappointed.

name: Get Outdoors Today
text: My favorite stores to visit. Love Bass Pro. Even the wife likes to go. Try to stop at least one Bass Pro somewhere on every road trip.

name: KG Gregory
text: Been to 6 BPS's around the country, best staff always read to help!! Definitely 2 👍up...

name: Donald Watts
text: Always can find the right thing for the right price.  Love this place.

name: Natalie Beaulieu
text: Nicely decorated store with rocks and aquarium with fish. The only I did not liked that it has a bunch of stuffed animals. I hope they are fake. I am sorry for that animals if they are real stuffed animals.

name: Lamar Baswell
text: My absolute favorite store! Friendly and knowledgeable staff! Great prices.

name: Luis V.
text: They had good selection. Also a great place to go if you want to get COVID. They were NOT enforcing mask rule. To afraid of making an issue. I spoke to the manager, of course he did nothing.

name: jonboy061478
text: Always enjoy going to bass pro restroom could use some cleaning more often

name: robert brukardt
text:
Clean and well organized.    Unfortunately they are short on ammo and reloading supplies like everyone else.

However the fishing section is stocked which is a plus.

name: Vance Blackburn
text:
This place is enormous!  We have visited one of their similar stores in Pennsylvania and were not disappointed.

Incredible detail to store layout and decorating makes this a place to see for yourself. A true place to bring the whole family for hours of enjoyment.

The kids will enjoy everything from the untold number of mounted animals to the shooting gallery. The usual point of sale goodies can be found at every register, but the real goodies are found in the old time store... The fudge is awesome!  Sit down meals and available at the in-store restaurant offering a variety of animal meats.

I was impressed with the knowledge the staff had in their respective departments. The gun area had well trained staff and offered many hints on the model I was interested in.  My wife hit the women's clothing like a fire sale and found some great outfits.

This store is very accessable to those people with disabilities. The elevators are great for those of us with bad knees.

This place gets a big five star rating.

name: Kim Low
text: Clean. Friendly. Packed out but after this past year I was happy to see all the faces (all employees had masks on but all the customers didn't since the mayor(?) ((The news)) canceling face masks in our area yesterday) walking around and shopping.

name: Brent
text: Always Awesome!!  Very  Knowledgeable people

name: Mike Brown
text:
I shopped online for sale items and placed order. All went well with online purchases and received email a few minutes later that my order was in progress and I would receive a email when all the order was ready for pickup. All this was at 6:00 am. I thought all was good and I wasn't going to have to stand in line at the store because I'm not in physical condition for that and do most of my shopping online. Thirteen hours later I received a email from Bass Pro that my order was canceled due to items now was not available and wouldn't be offered at that price again after that sale date.
The online service is not your friend and is not a good way to shop deals at Bass Pro..☹
There's other stores that have excellent online service !

name: Jody Carter
text: We arrived 45 minutes prior to closing and needed camping supplies. A staff member at the door pointed us upstairs and we headed towards Camping. There were no staff upstairs and we couldn't find what we needed. I had to go downstairs and into the Fishing section to find an employee. He said everyone was doing inventory and not helping customers. He looked online, found the item I needed, and confirmed the were out of stock. He then referred me to Walmart if I need it quickly.

name: James Hunter
text:
If I had to explain why its great...
Walk in , feel it and stay. Don't feel it...probably not your cup of coffee.

name: Dave Murzin
text: Bass Pro Shops has everything an outdoorsman could want. Friendly and helpful staff.

name: ArkanShadowFox H.E.B.
text: Good place, clean floors, but children need to be supervised better. Too many parents let their kids run around screaming by the gun cases on the second floor. Very distracting.

name: Lindy Cowart
text: A lot of fun, but merchandise is way overpriced 😕

name: Patricia Green
text: The staff in the fishing dept. Totally ignored me and they could see I was looking intensely for something.  Cashier staff was wonderful.

name: Maxie Evans
text: Clean, well planned store. Helpful staff

name: Marie Shearer Berlanga
text: Always the best hunting and fishing items.

name: Morgan
text: Great store!  Awesome fishing gear selection.

name: Laura Johnson
text: I was absolutely amazed at how this place was set up.

name: Harvey Mellard
text: Very cool store, large selection and wide variety of outdoor sports represented. This is my first time inside one of these stores and even though I knew what to expect, I was still wowwed

name: Lillie Peden
text: Easter Bunny pictures were a disaster. What is the point of having an appointment when appointment times are not even remotely met?  Line was a disaster and customers were required to ask people in line what their appointment times were and to move in front of those customers if their time was sooner?!?  4-5 people scheduled at the same time. What a waste of time fighting traffic to get over there.

name: James Williams
text: Great place to shop for fishing, camping & hunting. The are Staff friendly and helpful.

name: Sabyn
text: We loved exploring every inch of this store. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Santa happened to be there when we stopped so that was awesome! While waiting to get our (free!) picture taken we were able to play with all kinds of stuff- kinetic sand, remote controlled trucks, and even a little shooting gallery. Awesome setup, awesome Santa, awesome time.

name: William Anderson Jr
text: Always enjoy our family trips to bass pro. Only complaint is they are a little pricey.

name: Callie German
text: Great store but we were ambushed by the time share folks in the middle of the store. We didn’t mind signing up for their email list, but they were very insistent with us purchasing a time share intro trip. It was really quite ridiculous, scam-worthy and rude. I hope management will have them back off of customers a bit!

name: Margaret Selby
text: I don't know what to say. I got a new outfit and a light jacket.  I could have stayed all day in that store. Love the real animals that were stuffed on display.

name: Tina Cuevas

name: Ally Costello
text: Took my kids to see Santa. Had an okay setup for the “North Pole”. I’ll chalk it up to covid I suppose. This Bass Pro is pretty cool layout wise. My kids really enjoyed the stairs by the fish tank to go upstairs. I’ve been to many, many of their locations and this is probably one of our favs.

name: Jeff Gardner
text: As near a one-stop-shop as you can almost imagine if you just enjoy or actually love the outdoors - for a wide variety of activities: hiking, boating, fishing, camping or merely hiding from the rush of everyday life. text: Loved my Experience at the Spanish Fort Bass Pro!!! A wide selection on everything. Lots of fishing gear and loads of boating gear. Tons of guns upstairs. They have a lovely Winter Wonderland for the kids to play in around Christmas Time!

I told my husband and son to just come on and go to the check out and pay for my son shoes and than we can go to the pet store and get the dog a bed there.

We went downstairs to pay.  Will not be returning.

opportunity to see Santa Claus safely

name: Jim Divers
text:
How can I cancel this order? Ordered on the 17th of December and still no info on when it will ship.
Thank you for choosing Basspro.com. Below is a complete transcript of your conversation with our Outfitter.

Chat By Chat (Sharla W.) (01/01/2021 07:12 PM)
[07:05:52 PM]You are now connected with Sharla W..
[07:06:09 PM]Jim Divers: How can I cancel my order
[07:06:22 PM]Sharla W.: Good evening Jim
[07:06:38 PM]Sharla W.:
It will be my pleasure to assist.  One moment please.

[07:06:45 PM]Jim Divers: W127276569
[07:06:54 PM]Sharla W.: Thank you
[07:08:36 PM]Sharla W.: I apologize your order should ship next week.  As it is in the shipping process, I cannot cancel the order.
[07:09:18 PM]Jim Divers: So if it does not ship next week how do I cancel?
[07:11:25 PM]Sharla W.: Unfortunately, due to the high demand, our warehouses have gotten behind.  We are not able to cancel order when they are in the shipping process.  If your order does not ship by Wednesday, please contact us and we will check to see if the item is no longer available or can be canceled.
[07:11:46 PM]Jim Divers: Thanks
[07:11:57 PM]'Jim Divers' disconnected ('Concluded by End-user').

text: Drove an hour to come buy a bow on sale. I arrive at the archery section and it takes 30 minutes for an associate to arrive at the desk. I tell the associate of the bow I want, and after 20 minutes they find the bow. I'm about to finally purchase the bow, and they tell me that I need to come back tomorrow morning at 9am because that is when another more skilled associate will be in who can set up the bow for me. I tell them that I have to work and that I just drove an hour and they tell me to come another time and call ahead. Why have someone work in the archery section if they are unable to set up a compound bow?

text: Great place to get anything outdoors. Even if you dont buy something. A great place to visit

name: Rachael Ralph
text:
We've come out here in the past to shop and visit with Santa and have had a good time. This year was absolutely dismal. It started out bad in the messy bathrooms. The floors were covered in trash. Only one of the paper towel dispensers were working, and barely at that, only if you pulled it out in a certain way. It took 3 strangers and myself to find the working dispenser and get paper towels out of it, it was a team effort.
There were far less people in the store than previous years, so I'm not sure what their excuse would be. Most of the children's attractions were broken or half working as well. The kids were practically bored to tears. We only stayed for pictures with Santa. Our wait was 2 hours. And by all means it should have been half that time. There really weren't many people in the store. Crafts that were supposed to start at noon didn't begin till around 12:30 and the craft person was stale and thoroughly uninterested in their job. Before when we had come there was quite a bit of interaction and Mrs. Clause even came over to help.
It was a total waste of time coming out here. Their restaurant isn't even open anymore. So much for being a kids event. I didn't even make our purchases, and we obviously had lunch elsewhere. I can buy this stuff elsewhere too lol.

name: Michael Thomas
text:
Mr Jim Hagale / CEO Johnny Morris

I purchased a boat through your company (Spanish Fort) and wanted to directly share my TERRIBLE experience with you.

13 Jul 20:  Purchased the Regency R230LE3 Sport for $67,759

After the staff inspection and detail of the boat, it was delivered to my home on 13 Jul.

After delivery I called sales rep to inform him that: Boat Cover not included, Ski Pole missing, cushion springs to get into the departments not working, missing console cover piece, crack in fiberglass of console, latch for shower bracket broken, trickle charger outlet not secured to boat. (Items needing replacement when purchased: Co Captain Chair had tear, 2 seat cushions had tears, sun shade cover needed replacement, radio (2 control panels) need replacement).

14 Jul 20:  Put boat in the water, trim gauge did not work..... AND BOAT STARTED TO SINK ON RIGHT SIDE!

Got boat out of the water, called sales rep and I took the boat back to Spanish Ft on 15 July.

Determined, leak in right side pontoon. Was informed I must go through the warranty process to get it fixed.  I have played this game now for 8 days.  NO CHANGE TO THE BOAT!  STILL WAITING FOR WARRANTY OFFICE TO CONTACT DEALERSHIP!

I told them to replace the boat or take the boat back.

I have been told by your Finance Dept to call dealership.

I have been told by your Corp Customer Service Rep to call dealership.

Dealership says:  That's not how it works, you will not get a replacement and we will not cancel the loan.

So, here we are.  Me emailing the CEO to get help!

The boat has not even been titled or funded yet.  This experience and your company customer service is absolutely unacceptable.  Bass Pro Shop sells a retired military man a boat that starts to sink in the first 30 mins of ever touching the water, confirmed by staff it has a leak and was told.... we will file a warranty claim.  Sorry about your Luck!

Can't wait to share this experience with my community, with your community!

Mike Thomas

name: Ronald Clement
text: Extremely disappointed at the customer service I received at this store location. I tried to purchase a flannel/hoodie combo shirt, that was marked on one of the middle store isle racks, for $17.99 as advertised on the sign above the rack ( at 0910 AM). They were marked down from $44.99. I went and did about 15 more minutes of shopping and went to check out (at 0925 AM). At check out the item showed up as $44.99 and I said I would take it over to refund for them to research the price further. The associate at the refund desk stated the price was never $17.99 and there was no sign there showing it was ever that price. My wife walked back there and could you imaging the signs mysteriously vanished from the time I picked up the item at the rack to the time I went to check out. I was made to look like a liar and a cheat by the refund associate and Bass Pro. The only thing they had to say was they had mistakenly left the sales signs up from the weekend and I would have been okay with that. Instead I had to listen to the other refund associate say I was in the right and the signs were removed late but she could not make the other associate listen to her. Funny how they want to thank you for your military service one minute and then make you out to be a liar in front of other customers the next. I will no longer be shopping at the Bass Pro Spanish Fort location and I would suggest that all customers take photos of sales prices on the racks for they are to be susceptible removed at a moments notice to prove the customer is wrong and vendor is in the right.

I arrived at gun counter no one around ,found a guy putting up stock showed my paper work .he acted like never saw an on line order.he brought out paper work I filled out , once approved,  I ask about red dot scopes. I was told find a better deal on line , didn't ask if I needed ammo ect .no one in the store was friendly,  acting as if mad they had to work.i won't be back over priced any way .I had no one ask me if I needed an help in the store .I was wearing ppe so what's up bass pro .I have a 5000.00 dollar limit credit card , I'd close it for not lowering my credit score. Teach your people some customer service,  or you might be joining  j.c. penny .

text: Bass pro shops is kinda like a theme park for outdoorsman, but with less rides. I mainly go there for shooting supplies and firearm related stuff, which they have in abundance. Most of what they don't have they can order. Prices are about in line with other stores, and selection is better than average. They stock lots of reloading supplies and tools, holsters, mags, and ammo by the literal ton.

name: Ordanumn
text: I turned in a compound bow about six weeks ago to get it restrung. I was told it would take about 3-4 weeks to order parts and repair the bow. After around five weeks I called to check on my bow and they said they would call me back. I recieved no call back so I called again and was put on hold, then was hung up on. I went to the store to check on it in person and after waiting 30 minutes I was informed that they haven't even ordered the parts yet. I am taking my business elsewhere,  sadly I will not  shop here again.

name: Roy R.
text: The store was very large and very well stocked and very clean. Of course, it must make it a lot easier to keep it that way when nobody buys anything. This is a store for the well heeled. 50 dollar shirts and 17 dollar ball caps are not for everyone. Their wide ranging stock and impressive choices are a spectacle, and the store itself is a must see, but don't plan a trip there AND Disneyland in the same year if you work for an hourly wage. Probably awesome for the pro's with sponsors, but I'll have to stick to Goodwill.

text:
I've had bad experiences my last 2 visits
I needed a new dehydrator so I went to bass pro, I knew what I wanted and where it was so I got there just about 20 minutes till closing. I zipped up to the section I wanted and saw what I wanted, well it was more than I could lift so I looked around for someone to help me. Not finding anyone I changed my mind and went with 2 smaller units as I'm standing there figuring the difference in price a sales lady showed up to tell me the store was closing that I needed to leave. I told her ok but she could put the 2 units back on the shelf. She changed her mind  so I took the 2 smaller units and left. Definitely not what I was expecting
Today I went to get some black Friday sales on electronics for ,y pontoon and I took2 hunting knives to get sharpened. I get there and I run upstairs to drop them off while I shopped. I asked if I could get my knives sharpened and the kid told me they were to busy selling guns that I would need to leave the knives and come back tomorrow. Well they lost around 2000 dollars in sales in electronics today because if that's the attitude of bass pro I'll shop elsewhere

name: Kerry AnnaBelle
text: We like taking a trip to Bass Pro shops for a quick family drive.  We used to go to the restaurant before it was closed but still a nice getaway.

name: Benjamin Harms
text: I'm not a sports lover or fisherman by any stretch of the imagination. But, I found this store to be really incredible!  The layout was a little overwhelming and felt sprawling. The line to see Santa was unbelievably long, so we took a pass on that. According to my sister, the best time to go for a picture with Santa is on a weeknight, rather than on a Sunday afternoon. Haha The stairway that trails up beside the fish tank was in and of itself a fun attraction. The elevators were even nicely themed to compliment everything. I was really impressed with the entire ecosystem that they have designed. The prices were higher than I would ever want to pay for simple gift ideas, but this just isn't a simple gift kind of place. The gift shop had some yummy options from party mix to crazy flavors of mixed nuts and cotton candy, and even Bacon Hot Chocolate (but even at only $1.49 per pack, I was still afraid to buy and try it). We also ate at the restaurant, which I wrote a review for separately. Great experiences to be had here!

name: Robert Watson
text: Employees are nice, helpful and friendly.

name: Johnny Collins
text: Great selection. Good people that are willing to help.

name: Marivel Preciado

A visit to the store is sure to be a positive experience even if you don't plan on making any purchases. It can be kind of just a fun place to peruse.

text:
Unbelievable.  This pretty much sums it up.
If this place doesn't have what you are looking for.  You probably don't need it.
Very nice employees and clean .
Very large and well laid out in sections. You could spend a complete day  in this store.
From fish hooks to complete boat rigs,  it's in this building
Price is ok and mostly competitive.
I was very impressed  and you will be too.
There are fish aquariums and very nice restaurants.
5 stars.

text: Very rude customers using foul language and actually being aggressive towards other families waiting to see Santa. I only let that effect my post because employees witnessed this and even let them proceed to jump everyone in line, silently, just to get rid of them. I wasn't raised to reward bad behavior! Other than that, very nice store, but you'll lose great customers to white trash just there for a free picture!

text: Went in the Spanish Fort location to buy me and my wife a pair of Costa's, and the lady looming around us just made us feel very uneasy. No better way to run off customers than to make them feel like you think they are thieves. I work all over the country and this is my "local" Basspro and can't do business with anyone who makes us feel like they we are thieves. No other basspro does this! Not to mention we both had Costa's on our head!!! Very disappointing.

text: First time visiting this Bass Pro.  It was awesome as any other Bass Pro.  The place had everything.  It was clean and well organized.  The staff was friendly and attentive, but not pushy.  I'll definitely be going back!

text: Wish they had better sales. I also wish that they sold more for plus size women. Not all women who like to fish, hunt, etc are considered average and shouldn't have to resort to wearing mens clothes for comfort
